channel.itunes:summary:
They met almost twenty years ago, playing best friends on TV. They’re  still  playing best friends, on TV and in the real world. 


But the lines are blurred.


Where does fiction end + the real world begin?

item.title: Leisha and her Canned Hams
item.itunes:title: Leisha and her Canned Hams
item.description:
After 20 years of friendship, on and off screen, we’ve been through it all. In this episode, we tell the tale of a road trip that challenged our bond – but through thick, thin, and canned ham, we manage to prevail (read: survive).


Our story originally appeared in Roundabout, a new Acast Creative podcast presented by State Farm about the sometimes hectic, sometimes hilarious – always heartwarming – moments from the road that brings folks closer together.


For more road trip fun, listen and subscribe to Roundabout wherever you get your podcasts.


Hosted on Acast. See acast.com/privacy for more information.

item.description:
Original Air Date: June 2, 2021


PANTS with Kate Moennig and Leisha Hailey

Produced by Melisa D. Monts and Diamond MPrint Productions

 

This week Kate and Leisha catch up with friend and co-creator of Supergirl and The New Normal, Ali Adler, who Alice fromThe L-Word was based on. They discuss Ali’s appearance on Donahue for founding the first lesbian sorority, how writing Santana’s coming out story on Glee was taken from her real life experience, and why gay representation in media matters. They also answer listeners’ questions on art that changed them, guilty pleasures, and secret relationships.

item.description:
PANTS with Kate Moennig and Leisha Hailey

Produced by Melisa D. Monts and Diamond MPrint Productions

 

This week Kate and Leisha catch up with friend and co-creator of Supergirl and The New Normal, Ali Adler, who Alice fromThe L-Word was based on. They discuss Ali’s appearance on Donahue for founding the first lesbian sorority, how writing Santana’s coming out story on Glee was taken from her real life experience, and why gay representation in media matters. They also answer listeners’ questions on art that changed them, guilty pleasures, and secret relationships.

 

Follow us on Twitter @ThePantsPod

Follow us on Instagram @ThePantsPod

item.description:
PANTS with Kate Moennig and Leisha Hailey.

Tegan and Sara.


"We three are the gay Rachels. We got trapped in our hair."


Tegan and Sara, queer pop-icons and identical twins, catch up with Kate and Leisha, gay icons and BFFs.

It’s literally a gay pantheon.

They all met 15 years ago on set of The L Word, and their lives have been happily intertwining ever since.

Hear what happened when a grizzly gate-crashed a Tegan and Sara garden party, and our hosts re-create an acapella version of the Tegan and Sara hit Not Tonight,


Edited and produced in the UK by Rachel Shelley.

item.description:
PANTS with Kate Moennig and Leisha Hailey.

Sport. And other surprises.


This is what happens when grown women get involved in Sunday leagues. What did those grown women do before Sunday leagues?

Clue: they built and raced cars. Yes, surprising but true.

And what did they do after?

Clue: ever heard of Volley B-ball? Didn't see that one coming, did you?

#LesbianVolleyBballCult


"That was a golden era of my adulthood."

item.title: Oh look there's the pants.
item.itunes:title: Oh look there's the pants.
item.itunes:subtitle: Kick off your PANTS
item.description:
PANTS with Kate and Leisha

Kicking off PANTS with this very first episode - how did the Kate and Leisha fairy tale begin?

With Kate Moennig and Leisha Hailey.


Kate and Leisha play best friends on TV and in real life. Every week, these two gay BFF’S, and the occasional guest, answer a fan question and dig deep for the answer. With opposing views often leading to oversharing and unqualified advice, anything is open for discussion. They debate everything from home projects, sex, gay life, secrets and money to fears, sports, pets and work. Listen in on this friendship called PANTS, because you can’t have one leg without the other.


Produced and edited in the UK by Rachel Shelley.

Follow us on Twitter @ThePantsPod

Record a question and email it to us: pantspodcast@yahoo.com

Music: Carol Parra @csssuxxx

Artwork: Lovefoxxx
